title: Dinosaur National Monument: Special Uses
body: Special Use Permits       Gatherings and commercial activities in National Parks often require a special use permit. The purpose of these permits is to ensure the protection of the park's natural and cultural resources, as well as to minimize conflicts between park visitors and your guests. Examples of activities that require a permit include:  Commercial filming and photography Weddings (and similar gatherings) First Amendment Events  If you are not sure that your event requires a permit or have other questions, contact: Chief Ranger Dinosaur National Monument 4545 Highway 40 Dinosaur, Colorado 81610 970-374-3004 phone 970-374-3003 fax Special Use Permit Filming Permit (Short Form) Filming Permit (Long Form)
